definition: seething discontent (idiom); popular grievances boil over
seething discontent (idiom); popular grievances boil over

sentences.english: Beyond economic and demographic challenges, China is roiling with discontent.
sentences.chinese: 除經濟和人口挑戰外，中國民怨湧動。

sentences.english: and at a time of popular insurrections in all sorts of countries.
sentences.chinese: 在那個年代，歐洲各國都民怨沸騰，起義不止。

sentences.english: People's dissatisfaction will continue to accumulate and spread like an epidemic in the community.
sentences.chinese: 民怨會不斷加劇，並像瘟疫一樣蔓延開去。

sentences.english: The people are boiling with resentment over the officials embezzlement.
sentences.chinese: 這個官員的貪污罪行造成民怨沸騰。

definition: lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
seething discontent (idiom); popular grievances boil over
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
style of governing (of minor official)/achievement in office
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
